intro: Agrostis kudoi var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth meadowgrass, is a variant of the grass species native to East Asia. It is a perennial grass characterized by its slender, erect culms and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments such as meadows and wetlands. Its inflorescence consists of a spike-like arrangement of small, spikelets. The variety inermis is distinguished by its lack of awns, giving it a smoother appearance compared to other variants of Agrostis kudoi.
